result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal Marie Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Crystal Marie Cook is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Crystal Marie Cook was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to report to Probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 04/13/22.

- 2 days jail credit in the event of revocation.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid at the rate of $125 per month through DOC.

Court costs of $243.00. Payable through DOC over the course of Probation.
DNA Surcharge of $200.00.

- DNA Sample.
- Absolute Sobriety.
- Complete a mental health assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Submit letter of apology to Joshua W.
- No abusive contact with Joshua W.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

11:01 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY:  Robert A Wertheimer, DF: Crystal Marie Cook appeared. Atty. Wertheimer recites agreement, DE has completed AODA and has set up mental health assessment. State moves to amend Ct 1, information forthcoming. Court amends Ct 1 to Misd. Criminal Damage to Property. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 - Criminal Damage to Property (Misd.). Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 - Criminal Damage to Property (Misd.). On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing recommendations. DE updates address. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 

Court orders:
Ct 1 - Criminal Damage to Property (Misd.)
S/W 1 year probation with conditions:
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Complete mental health assessment and follow any recommended treatment
- Submit letter of apology to Joshua W.
- No abusive contact with Joshua W.
- Restitution $1,967.43, payable to Joshua W.; payable through DOC
- Restitution to be paid at the rate of $125 per month through DOC until paid in full
- Court Costs $243; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through DOC

2 days jail credit.

Status conference on February 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joshua A. White or his residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONE TIME ONLY.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
